ovdesc.p: Conversion tables are used to translate from an external value to internal value before performing the mapping (see XT.MATCH.MAP) or vice versa (see XT.OUTPUT).
A typical example is the conversion of an external source's industry codes to the codes used in the application.

Note thatby having an empty external value paired with an internal value, this value becomes the default value of this table for incoming data, i.e. if the incoming value is not in the table, then convert it to this default value (and vice versa for outgoing data).

Having a table with ONLY a default pair of values means that ANY incoming value will take the default value. So, by specifying a dummy field on XT.RECORD.DEFS, specifying a 'default only' conversion table, and mapping it onto internal files, you can force values onto internal files that need not be related to incoming data.
